channel.description: Stay up to date on all the latest Drone News

item.title: Community Colleges in CO Collaborate: Students Shoot Drone Video for Toyota Commercials
item.dc:creator: Miriam McNabb
item.description:
Two community colleges in CO collaborate to shoot drone footage for a regional Toyota commercials. The commercials were filmed in May and October 2022. The project was made possible through a unique partnership between the Community College of Aurora’s Colorado Film School (CFS) and a contract with the Saatchi & Saatchi advertising agency. CFS has […]

The post Community Colleges in CO Collaborate: Students Shoot Drone Video for Toyota Commercials appeared first on DRONELIFE.

item.title: Archer Aviation Reveals Passenger eVTOL, Midnight
item.dc:creator: Miriam McNabb
item.description:
Archer Aviation Reveals Midnight Production eVTOL Aircraft by DRONELIFE Staff Writer Ian M. Crosby Archer Aviation [NYSE:ACHR] is one of the holdings in the AdvisorShares Drone Technology ETF [NYSE ARCA:UAV], the only ETF dedicated to the drone economy. For complete list of holdings click here. The AdvisorShares Drone Technology ETF is a thematic investment strategy […]

item.title: CrewID™: Giving Drone Teams the Identification and Access They Need
item.dc:creator: Miriam McNabb
item.description:
Beyond the Yellow Vest: CrewID™ is the Real ID for Drone Operators The drone industry is ready to scale. Drones are increasingly visible on worksites that range from construction to telecomm, and in residential areas for applications like delivery or power line maintenance. Continue reading below, or listen: DroneLife · CrewID – Giving – Unmanned […]

item.title: Pix4D, Axians France Partner for Digital Twins of Telecom Infrastructure
item.dc:creator: Miriam McNabb
item.description:
Axians France Partners with Pix4D for Digital Twins of Telecom Infrastructure by DRONELIFE Staff Writer Ian M. Crosby Axians France has formed a partnership with digital modeling company Pix4D that will grant its customers – operators and telecom infrastructure managers – access to digital twins of their infrastructures. Continue reading below, or listen: DroneLife · […]

The post Pix4D, Axians France Partner for Digital Twins of Telecom Infrastructure appeared first on DRONELIFE.

item.title: Converting Broadcast ID to Network ID: ANRA Wins FAA Contract to Explore Options for Remote ID for Drones
item.dc:creator: Miriam McNabb
item.description:
ANRA Technologies Obtains FAA Contract for Broadcast Remote ID Project by DRONELIFE Staff Writer Ian M. Crosby Airspace management solutions provider ANRA Technologies has announced the award of a contract to demonstrate the ability to gather Broadcast Remote ID (B-RID) messages and convert and retransmit them as Network Remote ID (N-RID) messages capable of being […]

The post Converting Broadcast ID to Network ID: ANRA Wins FAA Contract to Explore Options for Remote ID for Drones appeared first on DRONELIFE.

item.title: Altitude Angel, Mopiens Partner on UTM in South Korea
item.dc:creator: Miriam McNabb
item.description:
Altitude Angel Partners with Mopiens for UTM Deployment in South Korea by DRONELIFE Staff Writer Ian M. Crosby Unified Traffic Management (UTM) technology provider Altitude Angel has announced that Mopiens, Inc. and Synerex, Inc. have joined its Global Partnership Programme. Continue reading below, or listen: DroneLife · Unmanned – Traffic – Management – In – […]

item.title: PG&E Gets BVLOS Waiver for Entire State of California
item.dc:creator: Miriam McNabb
item.description:
PG&E Obtains California-wide BVLOS Waiver by DRONELIFE Staff Writer Ian M. Crosby Public safety and critical infrastructure UAS consulting group Skyfire Consulting announced that it has successfully assisted Pacific Gas & Electric (PG&E) in acquiring a Beyond Visual Line of Sight (BVLOS) waiver under a Part 107 for the entire state of California. Continue reading […]

The post PG&E Gets BVLOS Waiver for Entire State of California appeared first on DRONELIFE.

item.title: Air Mobility Testbed in France Launched: Open for UAM Ecosystem
item.dc:creator: Miriam McNabb
item.description:
Vertiport Testbed for UAM Testing Launches in Paris by DRONELIFE Staff Writer Ian M. Crosby Images courtesy Volocopter Groupe ADP, Skyports and Volocopter have together commissioned Europe’s premier fully integrated vertiport terminal for the urban air mobility (UAM) industry at the Groupe ADP, RATP Group and Choose Paris Region-run Re.Invent Air Mobility testbed at Pontoise-Cormeilles […]

The post Air Mobility Testbed in France Launched: Open for UAM Ecosystem appeared first on DRONELIFE.

item.title: The Top Drone Service Providers in the Industry: DRONEII’s Picks for 2022
item.dc:creator: Miriam McNabb
item.description:
Drone Industry Insights (DRONEII) has named this year’s top drone service providers. Correction: a previous version of this article incorrectly identified Aerodyne Group as a US-based company. Aerodyne Group is founded and based in Malaysia. Continue reading below, or listen: DroneLife · DRONEII – Names – Top – Drone – Service – Providers Winners were […]
